definition: Chongzhen, reign name of last Ming emperor (1628-1644)
high/sublime/lofty/to esteem/to worship
surname Chong
auspicious/lucky

sentences.english: The last Emperor of the Ming Dynasty was known as Congzhen ("Noble Portent").
sentences.chinese: 明朝最後一位皇帝，名叫崇禎。

sentences.english: In particular, Chongzhen disaster almost every year, everywhere is a bust of depression.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是崇禎年間幾乎年年有災，到處是一片蕭條之景。

sentences.english: In Chong Zhen years of Ming Dynasty, some horizontal sundials and star dials were made.
sentences.chinese: 明代崇禎年間曾製作過平面日晷和星晷。

sentences.english: The end of the Ming Dynasty started from the last emperor, Emperor Sizong's reign - the reign went by the name Chongzhen.
sentences.chinese: 明朝的終結開始於最後一位皇帝，明思宗崇禎的統治。

sentences.english: The last emperor of Ming Dynasty, Chongzhen, committed suicide by hanging himself here in 1644.
sentences.chinese: 明朝的末代皇帝，崇禎在1644年於此上吊自殺。

definition: reign name of Ming emperor (1573-1619)
reign name of second Qing emperor (1644-1662)

reign name (1909-1911) of the last Qing emperor Pu Yi 溥儀|溥仪
capital of a country (literary)
Taiping Heavenly Kingdom (1851-1864)
Wei Zhongxian (1568-1627), infamous eunuch politician of late Ming
to sacrifice one's life by loyalty (to one's prince, one's husband etc)
reign name of Qing emperor (1850-1861)/Xianfeng county in Enshi Tujia and Miao autonomous prefecture 恩施土家族苗族自治州[En1 shi1 Tu3 jia1 zu2 Miao2 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Hubei
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
to act as regent

Ministry of (Confucian) Rites (in imperial China)
